_header: O woeful heart prisoned in great duress
Subjects: complaints; lovers, advice to; advice, to lovers
_description: A Compleynt, possibly by the Duke of Suffolk — three stanzas rhyme royal

BodFair16.First Lines:
O wofull hert prisound in gret duresseWhich canst not playn nor
                    opyn thy dysese…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…And trysteth well that in ryght goodly wysseShe wyll reward
                    the for thy seruysse
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
